UR10e

The Universal Robots UR10 is a robotic arm widely used in robotics applications. Its ROS (Robot Operating System) integration allows seamless communication and control. Users can leverage ROS functionalities to program and orchestrate UR10 movements, enabling advanced automation tasks. Integration includes ROS packages like universal_robot for easy implementation.

Submodules

robot.ur.main_robot_connexion.robot_connexion(state: bool)[source]

This function allowed you to established the robot connexion

Parameters:

state (bool) – boolean state, no default value

Returns:

success, message

Return type:

bool, str

Trajectory module

robot.ur.main_robot_trajectory.articular_trajectory(robot, command)[source]
robot.ur.main_robot_trajectory.cartesian_trajectory(robot, command, move, tool_position)[source]
robot.ur.main_robot_trajectory.robot_create_quaternions(pose)[source]
robot.ur.main_robot_trajectory.robot_get_info(info_type, robot)[source]
robot.ur.main_robot_trajectory.robot_trajectory(trajectory_type, robot, command, move=None, tool_position='down')[source]

This function is call in order run a trajectory

Parameters:

  • trajectory_type (str) – The trajectory type ( articular or cartesian )

  • robot – Robot interface return from the robot connexion

  • command (list) – the robot command that you want to execute ( list or “initial_position”)

  • move (str) – the default value is None, your can also use “relative”

  • tool_position (str) – the position of the tool ( down or horizontal )

Returns:

success, message

Return type:

bool, str
